MILLENNIUM.Definition: a period of a thousand years

PREDECESSORS.Definition: someone or something that came before (something else)

COLONISE.Definition: to establish political rule over another country

SHORTCUT.Definition: a shorter route than the usual one

TRACTION.Definition: if an idea gains traction, it starts to be more accepted

LOCKS.Definition: a part of a canal that is closed by gates in order to adjust the water level to move boats up or down

TRENCH.Definition: a narrow hole dug in the ground

CHOLERA.Definition: a serious infection caused by drinking infected water or food

EPIDEMIC.Definition: when a disease appears in large quantities

MARVEL.Definition: something that is incredibly useful or beautiful

SHARE.Definition: a percentage of a company held by an individual or organisation

QUITE A STEAL.Definition: if something is quite a steal, it means a low price was paid for it compared to its value

EXERT.Definition: use force to make something happen

ASSET.Definition: a valuable quality, skill, object, or person

COLONY.Definition: a country politically controlled by another

NATIONALISM.Definition: the desire by a group of people within a country to be independent

FINANCING.Definition: money needed to do a particular thing

ALLIANCE.Definition: a group of people or countries who have agreed to work together

NATIONALISED.Definition: when a government takes control of a business and declares that it is owned by the state

FOR GOOD MEASURE.Definition: in addition to something that has already been done

MINES.Definition: explosives hidden beneath the ground or underwater

INTERVENED.Definition: became involved in a difficult situation in order to influence the result

WITH THEIR TAILS BETWEEN THEIR LEGS.Definition: embarrassed or unhappy because they failed or were humiliated

INCENTIVE.Definition: something that encourages someone to do something
